channel.title: Parking and job permits?
channel.description:
Okay, so my last quarter I didn't do so well. Honestly, I didn't do so well this quarter either, but I have all passing grades. But, I'm in a bit of a situation that I think might happen when I go back.
You see, at my school, if you don't have a passing grade by the end of the quarter (above a 59%) you get your job and parking permit taken away. I'm sure many schools do this, which is why I'm asking you this question. I had a 59% in my pre-calculus class, mind you I put no effort into it, and got my parking and job permit taken away last quarter. This quarter, I managed to get a 67%. I know, it's not much better, but hey at least I passed. The thing I'm worried about is that if I failed for the semester, will they take that into account for my permits?
I might have failed for the semester, due to mid-terms being 15% of my semester grade. I'm worried that they will take the semester grade into account, even though they normally take the quarters. Does anyone know for sure?

item.title: Parking and job permits?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:326177”]I’m taking it next year. (Age 15)

I hope it’s as easy as you say.[/quote]
Trust me, it’s easy. I’ve gotten $50 worth of gift cards for getting the highest math grade on assesments in like a month.

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:19, topic:326177”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=422590.msg3104627#msg3104627 date=1264033880]
I’m taking it next year. (Age 15)

I hope it’s as easy as you say.
[/quote]It’s incredibly easy as long as you know what to do. I’m paying attention now and it’s almost obvious.

[quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=422590.msg3104609#msg3104609 date=1264033314]
WHAT?! 59% in pre-calculus?!

I didn’t try at ALL and I got a 99.8 average, lol. Pre-calculus is the easiest math class I’ve taken.
[/quote]I know =. Honestly though, I didn’t try at all. My tasks consisted of screwing and unscrewing my propel bottle cap, drawing, and talking. My teacher would give the lesson for like 10 minutes and give us the rest of the time to work on the assignment as a group and talk as much as we wanted.[/quote]

Lol, I have my midterm for precalc tomorrow. Hoping to get that $25 gift card to the movies. Just gotta get the highest grade.

Read full topic

item.title: Parking and job permits?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:15, topic:326177”]Man our schooling system is so inferior by the sounds of it.[/quote]No, my school is just filled with restriction nazis and feels the need to rule your life so long as you’re a part of the school. It’s honestly a load of shit what they do. A friend of mine got into a fight and someone recorded a video of it. Well, The principle lied a said he had the tape and called everyone down to the office that he thought was in the video and told them to sign a slip saying that they were in it. Everyone believed that he had the tape, so we all signed it and were potentially facing a charge on our records for disorderly conduct. My friend, on the other hand, got expelled for the first semester. All this happened before he even got a hold of the tape.

Read full topic

item.title: Parking and job permits?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:9, topic:326177”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=422590.msg3102146#msg3102146 date=1263778556]
Okay, so my last quarter I didn’t do so well. Honestly, I didn’t do so well this quarter either, but I have all passing grades. But, I’m in a bit of a situation that I think might happen when I go back.

You see, at my school, if you don’t have a passing grade by the end of the quarter (above a 59%) you get your job and parking permit taken away. I’m sure many schools do this, which is why I’m asking you this question. I had a 59% in my pre-calculus class, mind you I put no effort into it, and got my parking and job permit taken away last quarter. This quarter, I managed to get a 67%. I know, it’s not much better, but hey at least I passed. The thing I’m worried about is that if I failed for the semester, will they take that into account for my permits?

I might have failed for the semester, due to mid-terms being 15% of my semester grade. I’m worried that they will take the semester grade into account, even though they normally take the quarters. Does anyone know for sure?
[/quote]

You didn’t fail the semester you need a 59, 59 to pass with an even 59. You got a 59, 67 which means your average will be like a 63 meaning you would pass the semester unless they use your mid-terms also, but if your school does it like my school it will look like this; Q1+Q1+Q2+Q2+M=???/5= Final grade. As long as you got a 60+ on your mid-term you pass for the semester anything lower and you will most likely fail…[/quote]I scored just high enough to get a 60% haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Parking and job permits?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:1, topic:326177”]Okay, so my last quarter I didn’t do so well. Honestly, I didn’t do so well this quarter either, but I have all passing grades. But, I’m in a bit of a situation that I think might happen when I go back.

You see, at my school, if you don’t have a passing grade by the end of the quarter (above a 59%) you get your job and parking permit taken away. I’m sure many schools do this, which is why I’m asking you this question. I had a 59% in my pre-calculus class, mind you I put no effort into it, and got my parking and job permit taken away last quarter. This quarter, I managed to get a 67%. I know, it’s not much better, but hey at least I passed. The thing I’m worried about is that if I failed for the semester, will they take that into account for my permits?

I might have failed for the semester, due to mid-terms being 15% of my semester grade. I’m worried that they will take the semester grade into account, even though they normally take the quarters. Does anyone know for sure?[/quote]

You didn’t fail the semester you need a 59, 59 to pass with an even 59. You got a 59, 67 which means your average will be like a 63 meaning you would pass the semester unless they use your mid-terms also, but if your school does it like my school it will look like this; Q1+Q1+Q2+Q2+M=???/5= Final grade. As long as you got a 60+ on your mid-term you pass for the semester anything lower and you will most likely fail…
